description: Structures the response to systematically analyze underlying causes of problems or situations. This decorator applies formal root cause analysis methodologies to identify fundamental factors rather than just symptoms or immediate causes.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The specific root cause analysis methodology to apply

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Level of detail in the analysis (for 5whys, represents number of 'why' iterations)

examples.description: Basic 5 Whys analysis of a business problem
examples.usage:
+++RootCause
Why is our website's bounce rate increasing?
examples.result: Performs a systematic 5 Whys analysis to trace the increasing bounce rate back to its fundamental causes

examples.description: Fishbone diagram approach to a technical issue
examples.usage:
+++RootCause(method=fishbone)
Why do our application servers crash under moderate load?
examples.result: Analyzes the server crashes using the fishbone (Ishikawa) methodology, categorizing potential causes into major categories like People, Process, Equipment, etc.

examples.usage:
+++RootCause(method=pareto, depth=7)
What factors are causing our manufacturing defects?
examples.result: Uses Pareto principle to identify the vital few causes responsible for most manufacturing defects, with an exceptionally thorough analysis
